item.title: Companion matrices as sums of $p$-potent and nilpotent matrices
item.description: arXiv:2508.09276v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove that, over a field $\mathbb{F}$ of odd characteristic $p$, a companion matrix $C$ is the sum of $E$ and $N$, with $E$ $p$-potent (i.e. $E^p = E$,) and $N$ nilpotent, if and only if the trace of $C$ is an integer multiple of unity of $\mathbb{F}$.
item.dc:creator: Andrada Pojar

item.title: Representations of weighted Rota-Baxter Jacobi-Jordan algebras
item.description: arXiv:2508.09394v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Weighted Rota-Baxter Jacobi-Jordan algebras and their representations are studied. Moreover, we consider weighted Rota-Baxter paired operators that are related to weighted Rota-Baxter Jacobi-Jordan algebras together with their representations. Finally, we define suitable cohomology for weighted Rota-Baxter Jacobi-Jordan algebras in low degrees.
item.dc:creator: Jules Anitch\'eou, Sylvain Attan

item.title: On Derived Lie Algebras
item.description: arXiv:2508.09642v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper we investigate the problem of which Lie algebras appear as the derived algebra of a Lie algebra. We present new results that further develop this study and address two questions raised in a paper concerned with the corresponding problem for groups.
item.dc:creator: Salvatore Siciliano, David A. Towers

item.title: $C^\infty$-superrings and $C^\infty$-superschemes
item.description: arXiv:2508.09900v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This paper develops a theory of $C^\infty$-superrings and their associated $C^\infty$-superschemes. We prove a key equivalence between the category of fair affine $C^\infty$-superschemes and the category of fair $C^\infty$-superrings. We place special emphasis on split $C^\infty$-superrings, which generalize the function algebras of supermanifolds and serve as building blocks for more complex, non-split structures.
item.dc:creator: Cristian Danilo Olarte, Pedro Rizzo, Alexander Torres-Gomez

item.title: Transformation representations of diagram monoids
item.description: arXiv:2411.14693v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We obtain formulae for the minimum transformation degrees of the most well-studied families of finite diagram monoids, including the partition, Brauer, Temperley--Lieb and Motzkin monoids. For example, the partition monoid $P_n$ has degree $1 + \frac{B(n+2)-B(n+1)+B(n)}2$ for $n\geq2$, where these are Bell numbers. The proofs involve constructing explicit faithful representations of the minimum degree, many of which can be realised as (partial) actions on projections.
item.dc:creator: Reinis Cirpons, James East, James D. Mitchell

item.title: Quasi-triangular, triangular, factorizable anti-Leibniz bialgebras and anti-Leibniz Yang-Baxter equation
item.description: arXiv:2412.20028v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We introduce the notion of an anti-Leibniz bialgebra which is equivalent to a Manin triple of anti-Leibniz algebras, is equivalent to a matched pair of anti-Leibniz algebras. The study of some special anti-Leibniz bialgebras leads to the introduction of the anti-Leibniz Yang-Baxter equation in an anti-Leibniz algebra. A symmetric (or an invariant) solution of the anti-Leibniz Yang-Baxter equation gives an anti-Leibniz bialgebra. The notion of a relative Rota-Baxter operator of an anti-Leibniz algebra is introduced to construct symmetric solutions of the anti-Leibniz Yang-Baxter equation. Moreover, we introduce the notions of factorizable anti-Leibniz bialgebras and skew-symmetric Rota-Baxter anti-Leibniz algebras, and show that a factorizable anti-Leibniz bialgebra leads to a factorization of the underlying anti-Leibniz algebra. There is a one-to-one correspondence between factorizable anti-Leibniz bialgebras and skew-quadratic Rota-Baxter anti-Leibniz algebras. Finally, we constrict anti-Leibniz bialgebras form Leibniz bialgebras by the tensor product and constrict infinite-dimensional anti-Leibniz bialgebras form finite-dimensional anti-Leibniz bialgebras by the completed tensor product.
item.dc:creator: Bo Hou, Zhanpeng Cui
